This role requires an organized, growth-hacking mindset and strong project management skills to take ownership of assigned clients and ensure a smooth and efficient optimization program.

title: Product Owner

responsibilities: Manage the product backlog:, Work closely with the Product Manager to develop, refine and prioritize the product backlog for an area of the app. Translate high-level product roadmap into achievable product backlog items. Ensure these can be maintained & operated effectively by markets and Mobility Hub, Deliver enhancements & new features:, As the Product Owner for assigned areas of the app, drive feature delivery through one or more scrum teams and other delivery partners both inside & outside TUI. Collaborate with UX & UI designers to develop best-in-class user journeys & designs. Compose User Epics, User Stories & Acceptance Criteria to a high standard, covering not only happy paths. Work with development teams to establish and document technical details needed for user stories. Work with QA, test & release teams to ensure all features are of the highest quality and timely, Monitor and drive kpi performance:, Take personal ownership of relevant KPIs and ensure that all developments are aligned to drive performance and have clear metrics, tracking mechanisms and targets. Highlight under-performance of metrics and develop plans in the roadmap and backlog in conjunction with the Product Manager to address these, Actively test & optimise to maximise performance:, Ensure existing capabilities are monitored and follow a plan for research and/ortesting supporting continuous improvement to drive up ongoing performance, Engage stakeholders effectively:, Liaise with a variety of key stakeholders in development and business areas, building strong working relations. Work closely with change owners and ensure all stakeholders are updated on a regular basis. Develop a deep understanding ofyour app section, performance and usage as well as issues or opportunities, Develop and apply customer insight:, Understand the end-to-end journey for TUI customers across different products and channels. Understand TUIâs customer segments and behaviors. Use this insight to inform and influence plans and development around KPIs and user experience
experienceRequirements: Product ownership skills, go-to expert for product areas, managing and maintaining a product backlog that delivers value for customers and is aligned with the Product Roadmap, Business analysis skills, able to analyse and map complex business and systems processes and develop effective solutions to customer, business and technical challenges, Experience working using agile methodologies in digital product development, Experience managing digital product life cycles end to end, Exceptional user story writing, able to articulate clearly and precisely what is required, and think through both happy and unhappy paths in detail, Strong stakeholder engagement, able to develop trusted working relationships across business boundaries, Experience writing detailed User Stories, Acceptance Criteria, Experience working with and developing consumer-facing digital technologies, such as websites and/or apps, ideally in a travel, retail or equivalent environment, Excellent communications and influencing skills, able to analyze and communicate technical concepts to create practical solutions and influence decisions, Strong customer focus, able to champion the needs of our customers travelling with us in every feature, Good commercial awareness, able to deliver commercial outcomes whilst still delivering for customers, Strong understanding of relevant digital technologies, with the ability to harness their potential to drive value, Good numeracy skills, able to digest and track KPIs and manipulate simple spreadsheets, Experience of working in a complex, multi-geography, multi-cultural environment
